text: Kentucky State University (KSU) is a public university for men and women. It is in Frankfort, Kentucky. The school was founded in 1886. Its original name was the State Normal School for Colored Persons. The university has four colleges. It offers four associate degrees, 55 undergraduate degrees and six post-graduate programs. ==References== Category:Colleges and universities in Kentucky Category:1886 establishments in the United States Category:Historically black colleges and universities Category:1880s establishments in Kentucky
title: Kentucky State University
